description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on the Bailiwick of Guernsey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates and other news 10-14 August
title_page: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates and other news 10-14 August - BBC News
maintext:
Guernsey's population increased by 561 people (0.9%) to 63,276 over the year ending 30 September 2019, new figures show .
This compares to -0.1%, 0.0% and 0.5% increase over the years ending 30 September 2016, 2017 and 2018, respectively.
The report for the States of Guernsey, published on Friday, said there was an increase of 0.9% in the number of people in the 16 to 64 age group - the largest annual increase in this age group since March 2008.
There were increases of 2.0% and 2.2% in the number of people in the 65 to 84 and 85 and over age groups respectively.
The report also included employment figures for March 2020 which show that in that month 30,987 people were employed or self-employed in Guernsey, a decrease from 31,230 at the same time last year.
At the end of March 2020, 1.6% of the workforce were wholly unemployed.
During the week ending 1 August 2020, 2.7% of the workforce (856 people) were wholly unemployed, compared to a peak of 5.2% (1,631 people) seen at the end of May 2020.
